intro: Blotia tanalorum, commonly known as the Tanalorum bladderwort, is a rare aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures used for capturing prey. The plant typically grows in slow-moving water and has delicate, floating leaves. Its flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, with a distinctive bilabiate structure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
